alert.note: Alert for Dutchess; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 2:14PM EDT until July 25 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Ulster County in east central New York... Northwestern Dutchess County in east central New York... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 214 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Port Ewen, or near Kingston, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Kingston, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Port Ewen, Lake Katrine, Staatsburg, Rosendale, Ellerslie, Lefever Falls, Maple Hill, Dutchess County Fairgrounds, Hickorybush, Rhinecliff, Hillside, Creeklocks, Lincoln Park, Saint Remy, Rosendale Village, Bloomington and Kallops Corners. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
